title: Camp Leader Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at West Texas A&M University
Interview Descriptions: One on one casual, basic leadership questions that pertained to the specific job role.  Interviewer was very easy to talk to, and very personable.  I knew whether I had the job before even leaving the interview.  Overall it was a very positive experience.

title: Presidents Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at West Texas A&M University (Canyon, TX) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met in a conference room with the executive assistant to answer questions. She wrote every answer I said. The whole thing took about 45 minutes. She was friendly and understanding when waiting for me to think of good examples for the questions.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you over came an obstacle.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at West Texas A&M University (Canyon, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: It is a short process where the Residential Living staff has to narrow down the prospects to the candidates for the job. It was a good opportunity because you have to sit in a room with other Hall Coordinators and Residents Assistants while they evaluate how you answer questions and approach topics.
Interview Questions: If a song described your life what would it be?

title: Bowling Lane Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at West Texas A&M University (Canyon, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of one sit down face-to-face interview with the direct supervisor of the position. It was a very relaxed environment and they were straightforward with me as far as the amount of hours I could receive and the pay I would be getting.
Interview Questions: Why do you like going to school here?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at West Texas A&M University (Canyon, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief interview with professors who need a GA. And then they accepted the offer. It took just a couple of days from application to an offer. If there is available GA hours, the department office will connect to candidates.
Interview Questions: Background check, major, available working hours

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at West Texas A&M University (Amarillo, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by 4 faculty just before the beginning of the Fall term. Each asked questions about my research and my teaching.  But mostly it was to convince me that they had the facilities for my research. However, they emphasized how much the teaching load was and the amount of committee work they had to do, since the faculty did all the work for many of the administrators. They used this time to tell me of the sad history of previous presidents who established a reign of terror.  I was also interviewed by the chair of the department who had been there during that time and told me that "academic freedom" were not words that could be used safely there. Then I was interviewed by the Dean who basically retold me the story about meeting tenure. It was up or out (although clearly not applied evenly to everyone there, as I was soon to discover.) I learned that he could pretty much overrule what my fellow faculty members wanted in that decision. Since there are extremely few tenure-track faculty positions, due to a steady decline in them since the 1970's, and increasingly greater numbers of adjunct positions of temporary faculty doing all the teaching in most colleges and universities, I could not decline this position. There were none others at that time.  92% of STEM PhDs cannot get jobs requiring a PhD, and thus makes the continued education for a PhD next to worthless or one of only increasing debt, if one pursues PhD level jobs. I also gave a presentation about my research. The presentation was supposed to show my lecture style, since most professors still use this as their teaching mode. However, I enclosed materials from my teaching portfolio for past courses which included the use of case studies for discussion by group work in my lecture classes, and some lab exercises I had created for various courses that overlapped with those I would teach at this university.  So most of the interview process was to tell me how important it was to have some realization of the environment I would be moving into. But I found out that this was only a tiny, tiny bit of the reality check I needed to survive here.
Interview Questions: Would I be comfortable with teaching a general biology course for students who were a mix of majors in biology and non-majors taking the course to satisfy general core requirements?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at West Texas A&M University (Canyon, TX) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involves behavioral questions as well as basic questions about skills and prior experience.  The questions are asked by various members of the interview team, which typically is comprised of three to five individuals, including the department manager, another member of the department and colleagues from the division or other departments with whom the candidate would work.
Interview Questions: You may be asked to state what you know about WT and the job for which you're applying.  Be prepared to say why you're interested in the position and what makes you the best candidate.

title: Utility Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at West Texas A&M University (Canyon, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Asked basic questions about problem solving skills and how you handle situations in other places of work. Very casual for an interview. Expect typically two people to be interviewing. They prefer you to have some customer service type of experience to be able to deal with people you come in contact with.
Interview Questions: How many jelly beans can you fit on a 747?
